seriesJson.title: Astronomy for the layman
seriesJson.description: Six programs on astronomy featuring Leon E. Salanave, lecturer in astronomy at Morrison Planetarium in San Francisco, and John Hopkins, interviewer.  Produced with cooperation of California Academy of Sciences.

node.title: Origins of asteroids
node.description: This program discusses recent theories on the origins of asteroids.

node.title: Light of the night sky
node.description: This program "Light of the Night Sky" takes a look at zodiacal light.

node.title: Telescopes and accessories
node.description: This program looks at "Telescopes and Accessories:  The Astronomer's Tool Kit."

node.title: Analyzing starlight
node.description: This program, "Analyzing Starlight," looks at how starlight affects observations into space.

node.title: The sun in action
node.description: This program looks at "The Sun in Action," discussing sunspots, solar prominences, and other eruptions.

node.title: In the beginning
node.description: This program discusses the origin of the Solar System.
